document.docAuthor: Farahani, Samira, Talebi, Ali Asghar, Achterberg, Cornelis Van & Rakhshani, Ehsan
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the subfamily Rogadinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae) from Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the subfamily Rogadinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae) from Iran

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnostic characters (female). Body length 4.2–6.1 mm ; antenna with 37–39 segments; compound eyes medium-sized (
Fig. 4
A); face 1.6–1.7 × as wide as its height, hypoclypeal depression 0.6–0.7 × as wide as its distance from compound eye (
Fig. 4
B); postocellar line 1.2–1.3 × and ocular-ocellar line 2.2–2.3 × longer than ocellar diameter (
Fig. 4
C), length of temple 0.6–0.7 × length of compound eye in dorsal view (
Fig. 4
C); mesopleuron rugose (
Fig. 4
D); vein r of fore wing 0.3 × as long as 3 -SR, vein 2 -CU 1 2.0 × longer than vein 1 -CU 1 (
Fig. 4
E), marginal cell of hind wing parallel-sided apically; claws simple; first and second metasomal tergites rugose, second metasomal tergite transverse, 1.3–1.4 × wider than its length, third and following metasomal tergites punctulate (
Fig. 4
F).

Coloration. Body to variable degree reddish yellow; antenna yellow to dark; head completely reddish yellow except stemmaticum (
Fig. 4
C); mesonotum and scutellum reddish yellow (
Fig. 8
C), propodeum variable, usually black; legs completely reddish yellow; metasomal tergites variable, black to completely yellow.
